meta.title: The Humorist - Witty Warmth
meta.description: Intelligent humor meets approachable warmth. A publication-meets-app-hub aesthetic - editorial sophistication with interactive accessibility. Smart but never pretentious, colorful but never garish. The aesthetic of wit, wisdom, and a knowing wink. Now with full dark mode support.
meta.product-type: Publication-style hub with app-like navigation to AI agents

typography.principle: Wide geometric sans-serif conveys friendly confidence. The Lexend superfamily provides warmth and readability while maintaining visual hierarchy through width variation. Responsive sizing via clamp() ensures readability across all devices.

font.name: Lexend Giga
font.note: Extra-wide geometric sans. The width commands attention while remaining approachable.

font.name: Lexend Giga
font.usage: Section headers, primary headings, card titles
font.note: SemiBold weight in muted color creates visual depth without severity

font.name: Lexend Giga
font.note: Black weight for small but impactful text

font.name: Lexend Peta
font.note: Extra-wide for maximum impact. Use sparingly.

font.name: Lexend
font.note: Light weight keeps large body text readable and friendly

avoid.reason: Serif fonts undermine the friendly, modern personality. This aesthetic is decisively sans-serif.

scale.note: All sizes use clamp() for fluid responsive scaling

color.principle: Warm and welcoming as a foundation, with a rainbow spectrum of accents that bring playfulness without chaos. Colors are soft, never neon. The Solarized-inspired base provides visual comfort for extended reading. Full dark mode support maintains warmth while reducing eye strain.

css-variables.description: CSS custom properties that automatically switch between light and dark modes

fleuron-colors.description: The signature decorative element - a row of colored dots used as subtle section dividers
fleuron-colors.sequence: red, orange, yellow, pink, green, blue, purple
fleuron-colors.usage: Section breaks, footer accent, subtle personality marker, masthead decoration

dark-mode.principle: Dark mode is a first-class citizen, not an afterthought. It maintains the warm, approachable personality while providing comfortable viewing in low-light environments. Accent colors remain vibrant against the dark background.

toggle-button.icons: Lucide sun icon (light mode), Lucide moon icon (dark mode)
toggle-button.behavior: Click toggles between modes, state persisted in localStorage

implementation.default: Light mode (respects system preference on first visit)

motion.principle: Gentle and friendly. Movement should feel welcoming, like being greeted by a clever friend. A slight bounce is acceptable - this aesthetic has personality. Content should slide in smoothly, never jarring.

animation.name: gentle-enter
animation.description: Content enters with a friendly slight bounce
animation.keyframes: from { opacity: 0; transform: translateY(16px); } to { opacity: 1; transform: translateY(0); }

animation.name: card-hover
animation.description: Cards lift on hover with elevated shadow

animation.name: container-slide
animation.description: Containers slide right on hover with accent-colored offset shadow
animation.usage: Content cards, panels, timeline items, table containers. The accent color should match the component's theme (e.g., pink for default, yellow for sun-themed, purple for moon-themed).

pattern.name: card-cascade
pattern.description: Agent cards appear in sequence for playful entrance

components.principle: Friendly and touchable. Rounded corners convey approachability. Generous padding gives content room to breathe. Components should feel like well-designed app elements within a publication context.

navbar.description: Thin, elegant navigation bar with logo, theme toggle, and links

layout.left: Logo icon (5 dots pattern) + "The Humorist" text (hidden on mobile)
layout.right: Theme toggle button + About link + Login link

responsive.mobile: Logo text hidden, only icon visible

theme-toggle.description: Button to switch between light and dark modes

icons.sun: Lucide sun icon, 20x20, visible in light mode
icons.moon: Lucide moon icon, 20x20, visible in dark mode

masthead.description: Publication-style centered header with title and subtitle
masthead.layout: Centered text with fleuron decoration below

agent-cards.description: Grid of interactive cards linking to AI agents

indicator.description: Colored dot in top-right corner, unique color per agent
indicator.colors: Each agent has assigned accent color

article-container.description: Optimal reading width container for long-form content

footer.description: Simple footer with fleuron and copyright

layout.principle: Generous whitespace is essential. Content needs room to breathe. The publication heritage means thoughtful margins; the app nature means clear, tappable targets. Balance editorial elegance with interactive usability. Fully responsive with mobile-first approach.

spacing.note: Default to larger spacing. Cramped layouts feel anxious, not witty.

adjustments.item: Two column card grid where space allows

iconography.principle: Friendly line icons with rounded terminals. Think of well-designed app icons that feel approachable. Consistent stroke weight, balanced proportions.

icon.name: sun
icon.usage: Light mode indicator in theme toggle

icon.name: moon
icon.usage: Dark mode indicator in theme toggle

decorative.principle: The fleuron (row of colored dots) is the signature decorative element. Use as a subtle accent - a wink, not a shout. It represents the full spectrum of personality while maintaining restraint.

fleuron.description: A horizontal row of small colored circles, one for each accent color in sequence

specifications.colors: red, orange, yellow, pink, green, blue, purple

fleuron.animation: Sequential fade-in with 50ms stagger delay per dot

agent-indicator.description: Small colored dot in top-right of each agent card
agent-indicator.purpose: Visual identifier linking card to specific agent personality

accessibility.principle: All interactive elements must be accessible. Color is never the only indicator. Touch targets are generously sized.

requirements.item: Sufficient color contrast in both light and dark modes
